title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for ONE correct description of how the process of globalization has contributed to similarities between Image 1 and Image 2.

Two points for TWO correct descriptions of how the process of globalization has contributed to similarities between Image 1 and Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following ways the process of globalization has contributed to similarities between Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways the process of globalization has contributed to similarities between Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways the process of globalization has contributed to similarities between Image 1 and Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that increased access reduces the time or perceived distance between places.

Two points for explaining how internet access removes barriers to commercial or cultural exchange and increases efficiency of trade or information sharing, reducing the relative distance between places.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to time-space convergence:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to time-space convergence:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to time-space convergence:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that artists and musicians connect through various forms of media without connecting this to the adoption of new cultural traits.

Two points for describing New York and Tokyo as global centers of cultural development (world cities) where artists and musicians travel and/or communicate to and from to learn and/or develop different forms of artistic culture.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following process by which artists or musicians in cities such as New York or Tokyo adopt cultural traits from cultures on other continents:
The response correctly states one of the following process by which artists or musicians in cities such as New York or Tokyo adopt cultural traits from cultures on other continents:
The response correctly describes one of the following process by which artists or musicians in cities such as New York or Tokyo adopt cultural traits from cultures on other continents:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that cities will assimilate cultures or people to make them more similar.

Two points for explaining how global centers of culture (world cities) like New York or Tokyo will assimilate peoples or culture in such a way as to globalize and homogenize the landscape.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the process of assimilation may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:
The response correctly states one of the following degrees to which the process of assimilation may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the process of assimilation may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the images donâ€™t indicate much regarding gender and ethnic identity.

Two points for explaining how gender and ethnic identity are social constructs that have limited impact or visibility on the globalized urban landscape.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of comparing Image 1 and Image 2 to understand differences between the gender and ethnic identities of New York City and Tokyo:
The response correctly states one of the following limitations of comparing Image 1 and Image 2 to understand differences between the gender and ethnic identities of New York City and Tokyo:
